desmoj.core.report

Class ReportMultRowsFileOut

  • java.lang.Object
    • desmoj.core.report.FileOutput
      • desmoj.core.report.TableOutput
        • desmoj.core.report.ReportFileOut
          • desmoj.core.report.ReportMultRowsFileOut
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MessageReceiver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ASCIIReportOutput, HTMLReportOutput

    public class ReportMultRowsFileOut
extends ReportFileOut
    ReportMultRowsFileOut is used to create a file to let the reporters write their reports to. It receives a reporter and divides its individual text information up to be displayed in HTML format on disc in the user's local directory. The messages are displayed in a tabular design with columns for each item displayed by the reporter. For each Reporter giving a new group-ID, a new table is opened. This leads to a number of distinct tables displayed in one HTML-page with all reporters grouped by their group-id in one table. This special ReportFileOut is designed to write reports with more than one row for one reporter. This is needed for the WaitQueueReporter where there will be one row for the data of the waiting slaves and one row for the data of the waiting masters and for the HistogramReporter where there will be multiple rows, one for each segment (cell) of ther interval. Note that if the framework is used as an Applet in webpages there is no access to the disc and an alternative output on screen or into a graphics window must be registered at the Experiment's MessageManager for this type of messages. Errors affecting the java runtime are always displayed on the system's standard output PrintStream.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReportMultRowsFileOut

        public ReportMultRowsFileOut(int simTimeFloatingDigits,
                             java.lang.String formatter)
        Creates a file to print reports into a HTML page. By opening the file, the necessary HTML tags to define a webpage are already inserted into the file. The parameter given should reflect the experiment that produces this file.
        Parameters:
        simTimeFloatingDigits - int : The number of floating point digits of the simulation time values to be displayed

    • Method Detail

      • receive

        public void receive(Reporter r)
        Receives a reporter and writes its contents formatted to a HTML table into a file in the user's default directory. In case of a ModelReporter it writes the model's information into the file. After writing the model data, all reportables registered with the ModelReporter are asked for a reporter and those are also written to the report file. After processing the Reportables, the registered subModels are asked to produce their reporters which in turn are recursively sent to this method until no other submodels are available.
        Specified by:
        receive in interface MessageReceiver
        Overrides:
        receive in class ReportFileOut
        Parameters:
        r - Reporter : The Reporter to be processed

      • offsetDescriptionsOneColumn

        public static void offsetDescriptionsOneColumn()
        Set report output such that nested Reporter descriptions are offset by one column, thus improving readability at the expense of space.
